Package org.forgerock.openam.entitlement.indextree

Class IndexTreeServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.entitlement.indextree.IndexTreeServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexChangeObserver, IndexTreeService, org.forgerock.util.thread.listener.ShutdownListener
    public class IndexTreeServiceImpl
extends Object
implements IndexTreeService, IndexChangeObserver, org.forgerock.util.thread.listener.ShutdownListener
    Provides a search implementation that takes on a lazy approach to policy rule retrieval. Policy rules for a given realm are only loaded into a index rule tree instance as search requests are made against that realm. This avoids there being a potentially large memory consumption earlier on and instead builds up the data as it is required.
    Author:
    apforrest

      • searchTree

        public Set<String> searchTree​(String resource,
                              String realm)
                       throws EntitlementException
        Given a resource searches the tree for all matching index rules with the specified realm.
        Specified by:
        searchTree in interface IndexTreeService
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to be used to search the tree.
        realm - The realm for which the search is to take place.
        Returns:
        A set of matched index rules.
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - When some system error halts the search from completing.
